query: "What was my hematocrit level and red blood cell count on July 7, 2020, and are they within the normal range?"
resource_summaries:
This is an observation record of a laboratory test for Hematocrit (Volume Fraction) of Blood conducted on July 7, 2020, with a value of 41.148%.
This is an observation record of a laboratory test for Erythrocytes in Blood, taken on July 7, 2020, showing a value of 3.9809 x 10^6 cells per microliter.
answer: Your hematocrit level on July 7, 2020, was 41.148%, and your red blood cell count was 3.9809 x 10^6 cells per microliter. The normal range for hematocrit is typically between 37-52% for adult females and 42-54% for adult males. The normal range for red blood cell count is around 4.2 to 5.4 million cells per microliter for adult females and 4.7 to 6.1 million cells per microliter for adult males. Based on this information, your hematocrit level and red blood cell count on July 7, 2020, were within the normal range.
